meanings.sent1: She is the jumpiest person in our group, always getting scared by little noises.
meanings.sent2: The cat was the jumpiest of all the animals in the shelter.
meanings.sent3: The jumpiest squirrel in the park kept running away from acorns falling from the tree.
meanings.sent4: Her heart raced like the jumpiest rabbit in the field when she heard a sudden loud bang.
meanings.sent5: The jumpiest puppy in the litter would bark at its own shadow.

meanings.sent1: Out of all the kids, Tommy was the jumpiest when it came to surprises.
meanings.sent2: The horse was the jumpiest of all the animals on the farm.
meanings.sent3: The jumpiest clown at the circus kept accidentally scaring the other performers.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement was like the jumpiest rollercoaster, reaching its peak before the big reveal.
meanings.sent5: The jumpiest student in the class would always startle at the sound of the bell.

meanings.definition: Characterized by sudden movements or reactions.
meanings.sent1: The jumpiest squirrel in the park darted from tree to tree, never staying still for long.
meanings.sent2: The rabbit was the jumpiest of all the forest creatures, always ready to dash away.
meanings.sent3: The jumpiest puppet in the show kept surprising the audience with its unexpected gestures.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were like the jumpiest lightning, striking with sudden inspiration.
meanings.sent5: The jumpiest bird in the flock would take off at the slightest disturbance.
